intro: Struthanthus megalopodus, commonly known as the large-headed struthanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Nyctaginaceae, which includes plants known for their showy, often nocturnal blooms. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pale yellow to orange in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its botanical features make it an attractive and drought-tolerant addition to xeriscaped gardens.
